titlestmt.titleproper: Dunya Ramicova Costume Design Collection MSS.004
titlestmt.author: Jerrold Shiroma

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-01-07 23:43:03 UTC.

did.unittitle: Dunya Ramicova Costume Design Collection
did.abstract: Costume designs and illustrations by Dunya Ramicova, Professor Emeritus at UC Merced.

dao.title: View available online items from the Dunya Ramicova Costume Design Collection

daodesc.p: View available online items from the Dunya Ramicova Costume Design Collection

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dunya Ramicova was born in the former Czechoslovakia in 1950. She immigrated to the United States in 1968. She studied at The Goodman School of Drama and The Yale School of Drama She has designed costumes for more than 150 productions of theater, opera, ballet, dance, film and television in the United States and Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes the life's work of costume designer Dunya Ramicova.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Costume Designs of Dunya Ramicova, MSS 004, Special Collections and Archives, University of California, Merced Library, 5200 North Lake Road, Merced, CA 95343.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oversized playbills for productions featuring costume designs by Dunya Ramicova. Included are playbills for the following productions: The Duchess of Malfi (ND); Tales from the Vienna Woods / Mistaken Identities / Mahogany (1978); The Vietnamization of New Jersey / The Durango Flash / Mister Puntilla and His Chauffer Matti (1977); Buried Child / The Seagull / The Bundle / As You Like It (1979); The Ghost Sonata / Reunion / Terra Nova (1977); Sganarelle / Man is Man / Wings / The Wild Duck (1978); Cosi fan Tutti (1996); Theodora (2003); White Marriage / Puntilla (1977); His Bartholomew Faire (ND).
